entries.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried will fly from Bahamas to U.S. Wednesday to face criminal charges
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried is set to return to the U.S., where he faces multiple criminal charges tied to the collapse of his crypto exchange FTX.

entries.title: White House and Congress prepare for possible visit from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, sources say
entries.description: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy could address a joint session of Congress in the House chamber no later than Wednesday, according to sources familiar.

entries.title: Dwayne Johnson says 'Black Adam 2' won't be part of new phase of DC movies at Warner Bros
entries.description: A "Black Adam" sequel won't be part of the next phase of DC movies from Warner Bros. Discovery, according to Dwayne Johnson.

entries.title: Auto executives are less confident in EV adoption than they were a year ago
entries.description: For the U.S., the median expectation for EV sales was 35% of the market by 2030 — down from 65% a year earlier.

entries.title: Nike stock jumps after earnings and revenue top expectations
entries.description: Nike reported fiscal second-quarter earnings after the bell Tuesday.

entries.title: FedEx earnings sink as soft demand persists
entries.description: FedEx said it will be able to cut another $1 billion in costs beyond what it previously forecast.

entries.title: Apple will reportedly begin producing some MacBooks in Vietnam in 2023 as it shifts from China
entries.description: Apple will begin producing some of its MacBook computers in Vietnam next year, according to a Nikkei Asia report Tuesday.

entries.title: Porsche begins production of 'e-fuel' that could provide gas alternative amid EV push
entries.description: Porsche officials celebrated the beginning of e-fuel production with the filling of a Porsche 911 with the first synthetic fuel produced at the site.

entries.title: Trump tax returns: House Ways and Means Committee considers potential release
entries.description: Trump lost a legal battle, which ended up at the Supreme Court, in an effort to keep his income tax returns out of the hands of Congress.

entries.title: Bill Gross says markets are headed for 'potential chaos' if interest rates keep going up
entries.description: The famed investor expects a mild recession could take a turn for the worse on tightening monetary policy.

entries.title: Three Marvel sequels are the most anticipated movies of 2023, according to Fandango
entries.description: Fandango found that moviegoers are most looking forward to Marvel sequels and plan to visit theaters more often in 2023.

entries.title: The EU agreed to limit gas prices, but some analysts are skeptical
entries.description: The Netherlands and Austria continue to cite supply and financial concerns, while analysts say the EU could quickly ditch the cap when it needs more gas.

entries.title: Amazon avoids multibillion-dollar fine as it reaches EU antitrust settlement
entries.description: Amazon made a series of commitments to address allegations from the European Union that the company was using independent sellers' data to its advantage.

entries.title: Elon Musk actively searching for a new Twitter CEO, sources say
entries.description: Twitter owner and CEO Elon Musk is searching for a new CEO of the company, sources told CNBC's David Faber.

entries.title: Not a 'panacea': UK lawmakers play down hydrogen's role in net-zero shift
entries.description: The lawmakers sought to temper expectations about the role hydrogen could play in slashing emissions and the transition to a net-zero economy.

entries.title: Bank of Japan shocks global markets with bond yield shift
entries.description: Global markets were jolted overnight after Japan unexpectedly raised the cap on 10-year Japanese government bond yields, sparking a sell-off in bonds and stocks.

entries.title: New British banknotes featuring portrait of King Charles III revealed
entries.description: The Bank of England released images of the first bank notes to feature the portrait of King Charles III.

entries.title: Treasury yields rise as Japan unexpectedly loosens its bond yield cap
entries.description: U.S. Treasury yields rose after Japan unexpectedly raised its cap on 10-year government bond yields, sparking a sell-off in global long-duration bond markets.

entries.title: Bill Gates: 'Our grandchildren will grow up in a world that is dramatically worse off' if we don't fix climate change
entries.description: In a letter published on his personal blog on Tuesday, Bill Gates addresses areas he has been focusing on in the past year and what lies ahead.

entries.title: Southeast Asian venture capital firms expect to be pickier in 2023 than in 2022
entries.description: Venture capital firms in Southeast Asia will probably be pickier next year, with valuations plunging and macro headwinds slowing down growth in 2022.
